channel.title: Fast download
channel.description:
I was downloading Ubuntu 9.04 at around 300kb/sec, when I accidentally disconnected my wireless when going to my Xbox. I re-connected my wireless, and then redownloaded ubuntu again, as it stopped the download when my internet disconnected.
When I re-downloaded it, it was downloading it a 2.3MB/sec the whole way through the download. I was like WTF, because the maximum speed I have downloaded anything before, is like 1.2mb/sec.
Just wondering, is this speed good? And what do you think could have caused this 'fast-speed' download?
[img]http://i700.photobucket.com/albums/ww4/primadude12/fastdownload2.jpg[/img]

item.title: Fast download
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:24, topic:290283”][quote author=primadude link=topic=383737.msg2881370#msg2881370 date=1248372499]

Considering i get on average a 6kb/s download speed, i would say that’s pretty damn good.
Ok, it’s on a good day today, here’s some proof, downloading a random server from downloads at 11kb/s.

I just wanted to ask this here, what are the causes of a bad speed?
I have BT broadband that cost me £19 a month, belkin G wireless router, and it sucks.

My average speed is between 400KB and 1Mbit/sec. I couldn’t imagine having a speed that bad all the time lol. I download albums all the time, which are normally 80-120MB per album; they normally take me a couple minutes to download.
[/quote]

It once took me 3 weeks to download a 700mb movie, quite well seeded, but it went at about 0.6kb/s most of the time, and i left computer on for the whole 3 weeks.[/quote]

It’d take me like 10 minutes to download that lol :).

Read full topic

item.title: Fast download
item.dc:creator: @Tulitikku Tulitikku
item.description:
@Tulitikku wrote:

Holy shit, how much do you pay for a 1.3MB/s connection? Since here in Finland, I pay about 25€ / month for a 200KB/s connection, it’s shit.

Semi offtopic: Get Xubuntu, much better. Also check out Wubi, if you just want to try out *buntu, you don’t have to think about data loss or partitioning.

Read full topic

item.title: Fast download
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“primadude, post:19, topic:290283”][quote author=`Jake link=topic=383737.msg2881271#msg2881271 date=1248366432]

Woops, I skimmed it to fast. I saw it disconnected an assumed it was going slow

Sorry. Nice your getting Linux!! WOO!!!

Yeah, but I don’t know whether it will replace windows, and all my files etc. I still want windows installed too; I just want to test out Linux and see if it is better/good.

Then get the Ubuntu cd it will let you completely test it without messing up anything on windows.
[/quote]

I’ll try that then. It says it will take between 6 and 10 weeks though; it’s too long to wait.[/quote]
just download the ISO and just run it in virtualbox or download it and burn to CD and run ISO

Read full topic

I don’t have 50 Megabit internet though because it’s not available in my area; the highest I can ge is 16Megabit.[/quote]thats 2MB/s is the highest you can get because of your internet package, if you have a flashed router or one that isnt a standard issue one you could theoretically get higher if the line will support it

item.title: Fast download
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:13, topic:290283”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=383737.msg2880635#msg2880635 date=1248316975]

When I downloaded and tried to install Ubuntu it fucked up, so now I’m using Windows 7.

Also, even your so called slow speed (1.2MB/s) I would take that in a heartbeat. On average I download at < 15kb/s

Unless you have dialup, I doubt you have anything less than 56kb/s
[/quote]

I posted proof on the IRC the other day ;), ask Sensored about it. (it was like 346BYTES/S or some shit when I took the screenie)[/quote]

346? I thought you said 15

Read full topic

item.title: Fast download
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

MB = megabytes
mb = megabits

Just to clear up the confusion

Read full topic

item.title: Fast download
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:8, topic:290283”]Its most likely that someone that lives really close to your broadband exchange centre was mirroring Ubuntu which caused the really fast download. Probably happened very recently.

and wtf, Ubuntu 9.04 32bit is 700MB. Why does it say 264…?[/quote]

It was in parts.

[quote=“Newty, post:9, topic:290283”]When I downloaded and tried to install Ubuntu it fucked up, so now I’m using Windows 7.

Also, even your so called slow speed (1.2MB/s) I would take that in a heartbeat. On average I download at < 15kb/s[/quote]

My average speed is about 500-1mb/sec. My top download speeds are between 1mb and 1.5mb, but today I was like wtf when this downloaded at 2.3MB/sec.

Read full topic

item.title: Fast download
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

_™:

2.3 megabits per second is a great speed, especially for something that’s 264 megabytes. Maybe could’ve been your Xbox slowing you down?

Nah, even before I got an Xbox I never had a speed like that.

Read full topic
